intro: Peltogyne recifensis, commonly known as the coastal peltogyne, is a tropical tree species native to the coastal regions of Brazil. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and distinctive, elongated leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody pods containing elliptical seeds. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in mangrove ecosystems and coastal forests. Due to its ecological importance, it plays a vital role in stabilizing coastal environments and supporting local biodiversity.
